title: Chelsea confident transfer ban will be lifted and identify two key January targets
text:
Chelsea are optimistic that their transfer ban will be lifted (Picture: Getty)

Chelsea are confident their transfer ban will be lifted and have identified Callum Wilson and Timo Werner as key targets ahead of the January window, according to reports.

FIFA banned Premier League giants Chelsea from signing any players last summer and in January after a probe into their recruitment of foreign players earlier this year.

But The Sun say Chelsea’s legal team are optimistic that the Court of Arbitration for Sport will suspend of even repeal the second ban after new evidence was presented.

The Blues are interested in signing Callum Wilson from Bournemouth (Picture: Getty)

On Friday, Frank Lampard was asked whether he expected to be able to sign any players in January and said: ‘I don’t know – it’s not in my hands.

‘I don’t want to speculate. We will always be looking if we can strengthen.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

If the ban is lifted, The Sun say Chelsea will look to sign either Bournemouth striker Wilson or RB Leipzig star Werner as back-up to in-form Tammy Abraham.

The 22-year-old has enjoyed a superb start to the season, scoring nine goals in 14 appearances, but Lampard knows the youngster will need support in the second-half of the campaign.

England international Wilson has developed into a key player for Bournemouth since signing from Coventry City in 2014, scoring 63 goals in 159 appearances for the Cherries.

German striker Werner, meanwhile, is rated as one of the hottest prospects in Europe having netted 68 goals in 124 games for Leipzig.

Timo Werner has also emerged as a figure of interest (Picture: Getty)

Chelsea will certainly need to bolster Lampard’s attacking options if Frenchman Olivier Giroud leaves Stamford Bridge in January.

The Premier League club are also plotting a move for a winger with Brazilian star Willian failing to agree a new contract and heading for an exit next summer.

Chelsea, who are currently fourth in the English top-flight, face Burnley on Saturday evening.
